text: Lothar Mühleisen (1876 – 1956) was an Austro-Hungarian and later Yugoslav lawyer and politician. He was a lawyer and notary in Marburg (now Maribor) in then-Austria-Hungary. When Marburg became part of the Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes after the First World War, he became active in Yugoslav politics and was chairman of the Politischer und wirtschaftlicher Verein der Deutschen in Slowenien, a party representing the German minority. He was a Member of the parliament of Maribor oblast from 1927 to 1929, and a member of the city council of Maribor from 1924 to 1931.Lithokarten aus Österreich: mit besonderer Berücksichtigung der Steiermark, K. Killer, 2001, s. 39 As a politician Mühleisen worked to increase the influence of the German minority in Yugoslavia in "all sectors of state and government."Miroslav Stiplovšek, Slovenski parlamentarizem: 1927-1929 : avtonomistična prizadevanja skupščin ljubljanske in mariborske oblasti za ekonomsko-socialni in prosvetno-kulturni razvoj Slovenije ter za udejanjenje parlamentarizma, p. 112, Znanstveni inštitut Filozofske fakultete, 2000 He was no longer active in politics after 1935 and fled to Austria in 1945. ==References== Category:Austro-Hungarian lawyers Category:Yugoslav lawyers Category:Representatives in the Yugoslav National Assembly (1921–1941) Category:People from Ljubljana Category:1876 births Category:1956 deaths
